description: From Medieval Latin marītāgium. Doublet of marriage.

nouns.description: maritage (countable and uncountable, plural maritages) (historical, feudal law)

entries.meaning: The right of the lord of the fee to dispose of the heiress, later also of the male heir, in marriage.
The property bought by the couple upon their marriage under the feudal customs.
The fine paid by the vassal to the feudal lord for failing to follow his maritage decision.
